publications.name: Evolving a Neural Model of Insect Path Integration
publications.summary: We use a genetic algorithm to evolve a novel neural model of path integration, based on input from cells that encode the heading of the agent. We demonstrate the capabilities of the network under noisy conditions in simulation and on a robot.

work.summary:
Conceived and developed a range of interactive installations using technologies including machine learning, computer vision, distributed computing, controllers, sensors, embedded computing and data visualization.

**Examples:**
1. With the help of facial tracking, a microphone and pitch analysis, participants could [paint on a blank canvas](https://vimeo.com/77349535) using their voice and head movements. 
2. An OpenGL based climbing game in which [a user climbs a mountain](https://vimeo.com/20260318) using the movement of his own hands 
3. For the 2014 FIFA World Cup, using computer vision and real-time image augmentation, participants [took selfies with the official mascot](https://vimeo.com/116658261) superimposed onto the image.

Implementation of my thesis [Evolving a Neural Model of Insect Path Integration](https://journals.sagepub.com/doi/abs/10.1177/1059712307082080) on a physical robot and publication in the journal "Adaptive Behavior"
